instruction: How was the deep learning tool box of Matlab utilized in the discrimination of B. cereus group members using artificial neural network (ANN) assisted Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy?
Output: The deep learning tool box of Matlab was used to construct a one-level artificial neural network (ANN) for the discrimination of B. cereus group members. This ANN was trained using Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy data. The FTIR spectroscopy data was obtained from the samples of B. cereus group members, and the corresponding species designation was used as the target output for training the ANN. The ANN was trained to learn the patterns and characteristics in the FTIR spectra that are specific to each species within the B. cereus group. Once trained, the ANN was able to accurately identify and discriminate between different species within the B. cereus group based on their FTIR spectra. The performance of the ANN was evaluated by testing it on a separate set of samples, and it achieved 100% correct identification for the training set and 99.5% correct identification overall.

instruction: Can machine learning assisted Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy be considered a superior method for accurately identifying different species within the B. cereus group, including those that are important in food microbiology?

Machine learning assisted Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy can be considered a superior method for accurately identifying different species within the B. cereus group, including those that are important in food microbiology.
